intro: Hieracium sagittatum subsp. capnotrichoidiceps, commonly known as the arrowhead hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with ray florets. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and habitat preferences.
